title: Drawing, "Design for Brocaded Woven Hanging with Menorah", possibly 1950s
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, on mount, beneath left corner of image:  TRUDE GUERMONPREZ/POND FARM/GUERMEVILLE, CA
inscribed: Inscribed in brush and purple watercolor, lower third of drawing, center right:  Yisrael [ twice, in Hebrew characters]; in pen and black ink, on mount, beneath right corner of drawing: MATERIAL/SILVERTHREAD (sic) + WHITE/MERO/COTTON/TECHNIQUE:/BROCADE WITH INLAY; on mount, above upper left corner of drawing:  IV [encircled]
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description: Field divided into rectangles of white and silver and white.  In upper right corner, a seven-branched menorah in brown and yellow.  In lower right corner, Hebrew characters for Israel "Yisrael" inscribed twice.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Brocaded Woven Hanging with Menorah", possibly 1950s.
possibly 1950s. Watercolor, pencil, white paper. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-50.
